metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11574 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper input validation together with an integer overflow in the EAP-TLS protocol implementation in PPPD may cause a crash, information disclosure, or authentication bypass. This implementation is distributed as a patch for PPPD 0.91, and includes the affected eap.c and eap-tls.c files. Configurations that use the `refuse-app` option are unaffected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11574` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ppp - 2.4.7-1+2ubuntu1.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the EAP-TLS patch is an Ubuntu-specific change in earlier releases

criterions.comment: ppp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1+2ubuntu1.16.04.1').
